event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of correctable errors on the interface between a MAC chip and a SC chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The number of correctable errors on the interface between a MAC chip and a SC chip
has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
 

   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      The JSC chip replaces both the SC chip and the MAC chip.
      These faults are still detected and they indicate an internal error within the JSC chip.
      The platform becomes unbootable.


   SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:


      The 8 DIMMs associated with this MAC chip will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domains using the MAC chip reboot
      or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

      The 16 DIMMs associated with this MAC chip will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domains using the MAC chip reboot
      or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:44:52 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 0ea4781c-0dc5-4728-ba80-bf3390c0c72a
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8005-G3 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8005-G3, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Minor
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:44:52 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 0ea4781c-0dc5-4728-ba80-bf3390c0c72a
   DESC: The number of correctable errors on the interface between a MAC chip and a SC chip
   has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-G3 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Memory associated with the MAC is deconfigured after the platform is power cycled
   or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   IMPACT: No immediate impact. Memory associated with the MAC is deconfigured after the platform is
   power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


        xscf> fmdump -v -u 0ea4781c-0dc5-4728-ba80-bf3390c0c72a

        TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
        Mar 20 21:44:52.5903 0ea4781c-0dc5-4728-ba80-bf3390c0c72a SCF-8005-G3
          66%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.ce-mac-sc

               Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mac=0
                  Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mac=0
                      FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                           server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                           part=CA20393-B54X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B/MEMB#0

          33%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.ce-mac-sc

               Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                  Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mac=0
                      FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                           server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                           part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: No immediate impact. Memory associated with the MAC is deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Memory associated with the MAC is deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Correctable errors on the interface between a MAC chip and a SC chip have exceeded an acceptable threshold.
